history.content: Personally, I think that this would be a good idea, iff you aren't doing anything else over the summer.  I find summer classes are in general a bit easier than those taken during the fall/spring (i've taken 61c, physics 7b over summer), often since they don't cover as much; the only thing is you must be willing to spend everyday working on the classes (which in my opinion makes it easier to focus/learn the material; for some people however this is draining, which is why they consider summer classes "hard").  As for the overlap, math 53 may help a bit in 7a, though it will help considerably in 7b (since all maxwell's eqtns are usually formulated in 3d).  And frankly, getting rid of your (lower div) math classes as soon as possible is always good in my opinion (since they are usually taught by terrible professors, which I would not be able to put up with anymore after 3 years).

Personally, I think that this would be a good idea, iff you aren't doing anything else over the summer.  I find summer classes are in general a bit easier than those taken during the fall/spring (i've taken 61c, physics 7b over summer), often since they don't cover as much; the only thing is you must be willing to spend everyday working on the classes (which in my opinion makes it easier to focus/learn the material; for some people however this is draining, which is why they consider summer classes "hard").  As for the overlap, math 53 may help a bit in 7a, though it will help considerably in 7b (since all maxwell's eqtns are usually formulated in 3d).

Personally, I think that this would be a good idea, iff you aren't doing anything else over the summer.  I find summer classes are in general a bit easier than those taken during the fall/spring (i've taken 61c, physics 7b), often since they don't cover as much; the only thing is you must be willing to spend everyday working on the classes (which in my opinion makes it easier to focus/learn the material; for some people however this is draining, which is why they consider summer classes "hard").  As for the overlap, math 53 may help a bit in 7a, though it will help considerably in 7b (since all maxwell's eqtns are usually formulated in 3d).

I am currently a freshman at Cal, hoping to gauge my interest in physics and get a head start with math over this coming summer before my sophomore year. I plan on taking Math 53 and Physics 7A at Cal over the summer, both during Session C. I recognize that both classes are difficult to begin with and will be even more rigorous during the summer session.

I am writing here to see if anyone has perhaps taken these courses, maybe even this combination over the summer. What are your thoughts? How difficult were they? How much work was it? Did you enjoy the courses? If you could share your thoughts on the matter I would greatly appreciate it. Thank you. :)
history.subject: Thoughts on taking Math 53 and Physics 7A together over the summer?
